result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- On Count #1 the Court IMPOSES 9 months in the County Jail, with work release/Huber, the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Jacobs on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

Days credit for time already served:  1  days

miscConds.notes:
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent

--random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

The Court determines that Mf. Jacobs has previously provided a DNA sample

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: JEFFERSON PD

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
per Agent

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:08pm [mo]
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses the enhancer of on/near park 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 without the on/near park enhancer; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 the Court IMPOSES 9 months in the County Jail, with work release/Huber, the Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Jacobs on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay $25 drug testing fee


Days credit for time already served:  1  days
The Court determines that Mr. Jacobs has previously provided an DNA sample 
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition form given
recess: 3:35pm
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 1/7/16
Defendant appeared in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

Case called at 1:35pm [mo]
[Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch II Intake]
[Return on Warrant]
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney De La Rosa.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Bond arguments given by Counsel
The Court quashes the warrant

The Court requires a $150 CASH bond with same non-monetary conditions as previously set. 

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess 1:48  pm. 


NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 3/8/16 at 3:00pm

Case called at 9:06am [mo]
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs in court with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Svehlek requests this case be scheduled for FSSC and Jury Trial with a STC prior to FSSC.

DA Happ requests that the Court alter its scheduling order to allow motions to be submitted up until the STC date.
--The Court amends its scheduling order to allow motions to be submitted 20 days prior to the FSSC
--no objection from the Defense

The Court directs Mr. Jacobs to the Jefferson County Sheriffs Dept for booking

Case called at 9:20am [mo]
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance
Mr.  Jacobs waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered


NEXT:  Status Conference on July 14, 2015 at 8:30am
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 10:22 am [Clerk SH] 
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case file documents, indicates that Atty De La Rosa was just recently appointed. 
DA Happ informs the Court that Atty Zarwell was previously appointed, resolution was reached with her and did anticipate a plea today. Mr. Jacobs was released from custody earlier this month, but did receive notice.
Court further reviews case and confirms that probable cause was previously found; notice was sent in care of Thompson Correctional & to a Racine St. address
Atty De La Rosa: Atty Zarwell did attempt to contact Mr. Jacobs; Mr. Jacobs did call back with a new address, but have not been able to speak with him yet, but do believe there is resolution.
DA Happ: Preliminary Hearing has not been held; requests matter be set as Defendant is still on extended supervision; not requesting warrant at this time
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
Recess: 10:28 am 

NEXT: Schedule Preliminary Hearing 6/15/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices

NOH for Defendant sent to LKA//Defendant in custody
Status conference on May 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2015 at 09:40 am.

[MK] case called at 3:21pm. 
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs in court appears via videoconferencing from the WSPS. His counsel, Attorney Yelena Zarwell, is present in court. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Jacobs indicates that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct. Mr. Jacobs indicated he anticipates release from incarceration on 5/12/15. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charges and maximum penalties are recited, reading waived. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed 
recess 3:32pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/29/15 at 9:40am  (2) Status Conference on 5/26/15 at 10:00am--please note in comments that case is at Prelim stage
Adjourned initial appearance on April 7, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

[MK] case called at 2:03pm. 
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs in court, in custody.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.   
Service of Complaint admitted.
Mr. Jacobs indicates that he mailed the State Public Defender the PD-application paperwork approximately twelve days ago. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance so that Mr. Jacobs can be represented by counsel at the next hearing. 
The Court notes that it intends to make a more complete record at the next hearing regarding a conflict; the Court does not feel the need to recuse. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
recess 2:09pm. 


NEXT:  schedule Initial Appearance on 4/7/15 at 3:15pm. (arrangements are to be made for Mr. Jacobs to appear by v/c on that date) --JA please note in comments that record is needed regarding conflict waiver
Initial appearance on March 17, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

case called at 3:31pm. [MK]
Defendant Jeremiah W Jacobs not in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Jacobs. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
The Court has received correspondence from Mr. Jacobs requesting adjournment and providing information that he is in the WSPS.
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance to March 17th at 2:00pm, indicating that arrangements should be made for Mr. Jacobs to appear by videoconferencing, or for a writ to be prepared. 
recess 3:33pm. 

NEXT:  reschedule Initial Appearance to March 17th at 2:00pm--arrangements should be made for Mr. Jacobs to appear by videoconferencing, or for a writ to be prepared.
